Interface Regime

All Known Implementing Classes:
BatchRegime, ChainedRegime, DelegatedRegime, DumpNodesRegime, EpochRegime, MiniBatchRegime, NearestNeighborsPreparer, ObjectiveReportingRegime, OneShotRegime, StochasticRegime
@DomainObject @Strategy(INTERFACE) public interface Regime
Defines a training regime for machine learning models.

A Regime encapsulates the strategy used to train an EstimationFunction (such as a model or predictor) on a DataSet using a specified ObjectiveFunction and Optimizer.

Implementations of this interface define the control flow of training â€” for example, how many epochs to run, how to split data into batches, or when to apply optimization steps. This allows experimentation with different training strategies without changing the underlying model, objective, or optimizer.

See Also:

  • DataSet
  • ObjectiveFunction
  • Optimizer

  • Method Details

    • train

      default <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer)
      Trains the given EstimationFunction on the provided DataSet according to the specified ObjectiveFunction and Optimizer.

      The training process typically involves iteratively evaluating the objective function on the training set, calculating parameterGradients, and applying the optimizer to update the estimation function's parameters.

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of estimation function being trained
      Parameters:
      estimationFunction - the model or estimation function to be trained
      trainingSet - the dataset used for training
      objective - the objective function that defines the training loss and parameterGradients
      optimizer - the optimizer used to update the estimation functionâ€™s parameters based on parameterGradients

    • train

      <E extends TrainableFunction<N>, N extends Number> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<N> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction<N> objective, Optimizer<? super E, N> optimizer, int step)
